questions.q: Which of the following is the most common complication of general anesthesia?
questions.explanation: Postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) is the most common complication of general anesthesia, affecting about 30% of patients

questions.q: What is the primary mechanism of action of propofol?
questions.explanation: Propofol primarily works by potentiating GABA receptor activity in the CNS

questions.q: Which of the following is the most appropriate initial management for laryngospasm during emergence from anesthesia?
questions.explanation: Initial management of laryngospasm includes positive pressure with CPAP and jaw thrust maneuver

questions.q: What is the most common cause of difficult mask ventilation?
questions.explanation: Obesity is the most common cause of difficult mask ventilation due to excess soft tissue and reduced compliance

questions.q: Which local anesthetic has the longest duration of action?
questions.explanation: Bupivacaine has the longest duration of action among commonly used local anesthetics

questions.q: What is the most appropriate reversal agent for rocuronium-induced neuromuscular blockade?
questions.explanation: Sugammadex specifically binds to rocuronium and vecuronium, providing rapid and complete reversal

questions.q: Which preoperative test is most important for a healthy 25-year-old having elective surgery?
questions.explanation: Healthy young patients undergoing elective surgery typically don't require routine preoperative testing

questions.q: Which of the following breast lesion is associated with trauma and lactation
questions.explanation: Inflammatory disease of the breast (mastitis) can be acute or chronic, acute mastitis is associated with lactation and cracks in the nipple during lactation, trauma and septicemia. Itâ€™s mostly due to bacterial infection. Chronic mastitis is associated with Tuberculosis, fungal infection and parasitic infection.

questions.q: Which is incorrect regarding fat necrosis
questions.C: Hard and irregular mass attached to the skin
questions.explanation: Traumatic fat necrosis is common in fat women though not limited to them. Trauma can be subtle e.g tight bra

questions.q: The following are risk factors of breast cancer
questions.explanation: Nulliparity is a risk factor of breast cancer not multiparity. Breast feeding decreases the risk of breast cancer

questions.q: Which of the following is incorrect about fibroadenoma
questions.A: Lobular and stromal components in variable proportion
questions.B: Most common benign neoplasm of the breast
questions.explanation: Peak age 21-25 years of age. It is the most common breast tumor in premenopausal women

questions.q: The following are features of phyllodes
questions.C: Peak age affected are 35-55, also affects postmenopausal women more
questions.D: Present with distended superficial veins and stretched skin often with ulcers
questions.explanation: We see rapid increase in size with phyllodes

questions.q: What is the most common presentation of breast cancer
questions.explanation: Lump is the most common presentation of breast cancer seen in 75% of patients.  The others are also present.

questions.q: Site of metastases of breast cancer include
questions.explanation: Kidneys are not a common site of metastases of breast cancer

questions.q: Which is the most common site of breast cancer metastases
questions.explanation: All the above are common site of metastases but BONE is the most common site
